headline: Seven Layer Bars
description: These 7 layer bars are so easy to make, and so rich and delicious! You can use different nuts or baking chips (vanilla or peanut butter) to suit your taste.

video.description: The classic sweet and rich cookie bar!
video.name: Seven Layer Bars

name: Seven Layer Bars

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
Put butter in 13x9-inch baking pan and place in oven until melted. Swirl to coat bottom and sides with butter.
Spread graham cracker crumbs evenly over bottom of pan. Layer chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, and walnuts over crumbs. Pour condensed milk over walnuts and sprinkle with coconut.
Bake in preheated oven until edges are golden brown, about 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Instead of graham crackers, I crushed up some leftover snickerdoodles with some Club crackers so these wouldn't be so sweet. Worked really well. And like most, mixed the butter in with the crumbs and lined the pan. Didn't have any butterscotch chips, so used more chocolate chips and added some real peanut butter not chips) to the SC milk. Yum!! This also helped to cut the sweetness. Thanks for the recipe.

Everyone loved this dessert! I used peanut butter chips to replace the butterscotch and warmed the condensed milk in warm water before pouring it on top of the coconut. Next time I'm going to use some spicy almonds to contrast all the sweet.

This is a great recipe, I use salted peanuts though because the addition of the little bit of salt is delicious in this dessert. Also I have made it for years and I prefer the condensed milk poured over the crust then the toppings pressed into it, they come out chewier like this, just refrigerate before cutting.

I have made these cookies for years and saw this recipe was layered differently so I decided to see if it made a difference. Sorry I did because they didnâ€™t bake the same. When the condensed milk goes on top of the coconut it forms a better top layer. The way this is under the coconut it didnâ€™t bake right and I ended up having to put it back in the oven after they cooled. They were so gooey I couldnâ€™t cut them and they were falling apart. Didnâ€™t think it would make such a difference.
ðŸ˜‹ they Smell Delicious!! I can't wait to try, I made the Glutenfree version ðŸ˜‹

I make these with coconut milk Bc my family is lactose intolerant I also add the Kraft carmel balls & dark choco chips instead of milk choco & pecans instead of walnutsâ€¦ Family fav. Sometimes I substitute coffee flavored chips or white choco ones holidays use red & greenâ€¦crushed peppermint .. such a fun recipe and super easy to take to work as a special treat to share w co-workersâ€¦
add 1/4 tsp of lemon jiuce

LOVE IT...LOVE IT...LOVE IT. This will be my new favorite, especially for a church-covered dish and/or Christmas morning treat. Tried it three ways: as presented, then another with just chocolate chips and nuts, and another with choc chips, butterscotch chips, and nuts. And, one with walnuts and another with pecans. Delicious. Could eat the whole plate, but better not.

One of my favorite bars, which I have been making for over 50 years. I make exactly as written, except I brown my butter before adding to the graham crackers. Brown butter and graham crackers compliment each other perfectly. Yummy recipe!
Wonderful ! I will make these for years to come. Blessings Always, Jenn
Made a change this time and put the condensed milk last. Came out perfectly and everything mixed nicely.
I love it. I just made it. Maybe I should have greased the sides of the pyrex since it got stuck; otherwise: excellent. Delicious and very easy to make.

I took advice from reviews and made the crust in a bowl first, then formed into pan and put in the oven for 5min. I used 2c graham cracker crumbs and 1 stick of butter, which made the crust just the perfect amount of crispy. One variation I got alot of compliments on was using semisweet, milk chocolate and peanut butter chips (made half without coconut) then after removing it from the oven, sprinkled honey roasted peanuts on the half with no coconut...yum! Ive made this recipe 3 times in a week with 3 different combinations of toppings and all came out great
AMAZING!!! It is soooo good! It is totally our go to dessert recipe!
Butterscotch is far too sweet for me so I substituted cinnamon chips. I also used dark chocolate chips instead a semisweet. Both substitutions worked well.
Just pulled the pan out of the oven. I wish you could smell them. Yum!. I used Mini Chocolate Chips this time and Pecans.

My husbandâ€™s Mom used to make these all the time for him, and he requested that I make him some as well. He said they were spot on and tasted just like his Mom used to make. They were wonderful and extremely easy to make. Two thumbs up

Iâ€™ve been making these for about 40 plus years & always melt butter in bottom of cake pan as instructed, but I lay the graham crackers whole over the melted butter. Works great every time. 
I cut them before totally cooled to make it easier to cut. Yummy!
Very good and so easy!
So good. Just like what I remember my Aunt making growing up!
I didn't use the butterscotch or walnuts. Instead I used peanut butter morsels and pecans. My wife really liked it, but said next time use the walnuts. Thank you for yet another great recipe !
My Guyâ€™s Favorite during the holidays.
I changed the recipe. Instead of semi-sweet chips and butterscotch chips, I used peanut butter and expresso chips. The flavor was sharp and delicious.
Definitely only cook 20 min.
Excellent, Thank you
Great recipe - classic seven layer bars. I make mine in a square 8x8 or 9x9 pan so that each bar is gooier.
Just like my Grandma used to make! Perfectly crispy on the edges and gooey at the same time. I hate walnuts so I substituted for pecans...will definitely keep this recipe forever.
Delicious

I made it exactly as the recipe states and they were delicious. Only 4 bars left the next morning. It takes a lot of cooling for the crust to harden up. Seriously easy and quick to make. Worth the calories!
Easy and delicious!
Delicious
I put the condensed milk on top as the last layer. I've made these a lot and love them.

They were great.
I substituted pecans for the walnuts and peanut butter chips for butterscotch. 
They turned out yummy

combined crumbs and butter (used crushed life cereal + nilla wafers+ pretzels). pressed into pan. poured a little condensed milk over it and then other layers as written but used combo of choc, dark choc, butterscotch and white chips. cook 24 min. Delicious!

These bars are like crack. They are soooo delicious. The only thing I changed was the amount of graham cracker crust. The amount given didnt line the whole pan. The recipe calls for 1.5 cups of crushed graham cracker (comes out to 10 full graham crackers) and .5 cups of butter. I added 50% more. So I used 2.25 cups of crushed graham cracker and .75 cups of melted butter. This made the crust an appropriate thickness. I put the crackers in a large ziplock bag and used a rolling pin to crush into powder. Used a sifter to get uniform thickness of the cracker crumbs. Came out great!

We love this recipe but I find the crust holds together better if you mix the butter into the graham cracker crumbs first then press into the pan. Also, I pour on the SC milk on at the end so the coconut doesnâ€™t all fall off when serving.
Made it, brought it to work, everyone ate it up!
a classic. I have made many times. Sweetened coconut works best. I use only one cup of coconut
My sister made this all the time when we were children. To this day they are as delicious as ever. Made these for my husband and always asks for more. And not to forget, these are very easy to make.

I changed out the butterscotch chips for peanut butter chips. I also added 1/4 cup of hot water to the condensed milk. My daughter said she had to freeze her part of the cookie bars so she wouldnâ€™t eat the whole batch. They are wonderful! We will make them again soon. Thank you for the recipe.
The taste was good, but it didn't firm up until I put in the reefer overnight. Like the concept, but will try a different recipe.
Doesnâ€™t taste as good as my mom used to make? I think it needs more chips and coconut? Also, the crust is crumbly. I will maybe try again?
Dont add the butterscotch chips, make them all the time yummy
Very tasty , great for the Holidays.
Iâ€™ve made these every Christmas and the family lives em
Left out the nuts due to someone having a bit allergy, but the all else remained including the coconut. It was delicious.
Should have doubled the recipe as they were eaten up mighty fast

The comment to put the butter with the graham crackers is a better instruction. Melt the butter and combine with the graham cracker crumbs then press into the pan. I used pecans, I think I would prefer walnuts. I also layered my pan with parchment paper based on comments. Tip my mom gave me, always make small bites, people generally donâ€™t want to commit to a big sweet, but small is more approachable.
Great recipe but one thing they don't tell you is to mix the melted butter really good with the Graham cracker crumbs. Otherwise they come out tasting like your eating the crumbs.

I love this cookie bar!! I always double the crust and butter to make a thicker crust. I crush the graham crackers instead of buying already crushed ones (makes a difference) I always melt the butter in a separate bowl and mix the Graham cracker crumbs thoroughly in the same bowl before pressing Into the 13x9 pan. I use dark chocolate instead of semi to help cut the sweetness. Make sure to pour the condensed milk BEFORE the coconut that way the coconut will toast in the oven. Soooo good. I always get so many compliments with these.

I made these with the following changes: I doubled the recipe, mixed melted butter with store bought crumbs then pressed onto foiled and greased (very important step) 17Ã—11Ã—1 sheet pan, I poured one can sweetened condensed milk over the crust, 1 layer of choc chips, 1 layer of butterscotch chips, 1 layer of pecans and 1 layer of coconut. Finishing with the 2nd can of sweetened condensed milk over the top. The baking time was 6 to 7 min longer so that the center of the pan could get toasted. I was able to lift the bars out of pan easily after cooling on wire rack. The pan was still warm when I lifted them out and I think that's helpful because once the bars are completely cooled the melted ingredients turn into cement almost. Very difficult to get off pan. I cut into bars and stored in an air tight container putting a piece of wax paper in between layers of bars and stored on countertop. Came out delicious as always!
Make these every Christmas
A little too chocolatey for us, but still good. We will be reducing chocolate chips to 1/2 cup next time.
I absolutely love these dessert bars!
I used pie dough in place of graham crackers to add a little salty taste. Yummy

Very tasty but very sweet. I didnâ€™t read the reviews before I made it but definitely mix your graham cracker crumbs with the melted butter before layering the other ingredients. Will definitely make again.
Yes, very good

I made it and it's delicious! I followed some suggestions and mixed the grahams crackers with the melted butter and pressed into pan first. Followed recipe but reserved a bit of milk to add on top of coconut, but may not repeat that step next time. I also popped finished product into frig overnight to cool and that made the cutting easy.

This is the closest recipe to how I make them (except I omit the butterscotch chips, and sometimes add other nuts, and occasionally crushed pretzels to the base, with a bit of extra butter). I like how it's all in one pan ... melt the butter in that one pan, don't need to grease the pan, all super easy. And they're a hit with everybody!
Made this and it turned out great. I used a little more of each ingredient to make the bars thicker. Cook time didnâ€™t change.
Excellent!
We have made this recipe numerous of times. In all different variations of the ingredients and its always FANTASTIC!!!
Super good! Kind of irresistible I used caramel chips in place of the butterscotch and pecans instead of walnuts. You can easily modify this recipes to your taste.
Very good. But Iâ€™m not sure how they say itâ€™s seven layers.
This recipe is awesome I get asked to make it all the time. My work crews love them
Extremly easy to make. Variety in nuts or type of chips is a personal choice. I found this to be very good tasting and overall a keeper to make many times over.
My fault it didn't turn out well it wasn't clear you need to press the butter into the crumbs. I used more then it required. I added more chips I should have just followed instructions.
No changes. I will be making it again.
Delicious!
Excellent! I think it would turn out great no matter how you layer the milk, coconut, chocolate and butterscotch chips! Thanks!
It did not really harden at all it seems like i used way too much milk but i used about 3-4 oz less than what it already called for. Dont understand what went wrong

I followed the recipe exactly, using the tip to melt the butter in the pan first, and then add the graham crackers and pack them down. They were just as I remembered them from years ago-so scrumptious! They cut and came out of the pan easily.

So easy! Will make this often as these are one of my favorite treats! There is a shop in town that sells them for like $6 for a large square, but now I can make a whole pan for that! I've had some others that I have bought that were not worth eating, but these.... YUM!!!
For those who love super sweet treats, this is the recipe for you!

SUPer easy and delicious. I made a couple of adjustments- I used cashews(instead of...pecans? walnuts?), sweetened condensed coconut milk(instead of regular sweetened condensed milk), and white chocolate chips(instead of butterscotch). Would definitely make again and i highly recommend you try it with these few adjustments, if you love coconut (like me!)
Outstanding. And when we bring them to other people's houses, there are always the first to disappear!!
Delicious! Very simple to make.

These have always been my favorite holiday treat. However, I've developed a depressing sensitivity to nuts. I made the bars last year and they were too sweet. This year I crushed up pretzels, for that salty crunch. Perfect!!
Used parchment paper to line the baking pan, as suggested by another user - brilliant!
Made it just like the recipe! Perfect! The only thing is that it is very rich and no matter how much you love them, you can't eat a lot!
perfect! definitely adding to holiday baking list

I changed Oreo cookie crumbs for gram crackers. I just love chocolate. My Grandmother used to make these for me, she called them Hello Dolly's. Don't ask me why. I find them made by bakery's every once in a while, but this is my first time trying it out for myself.
These are so good! I added half a cup more graham cracker crumbs and more butter because I like the crust. They are very messy, though. But delicious and so easy to make.
No

We love these decadent cookies, but in the years Iâ€™ve been making them, Iâ€™ve never layered them. I just mix all together and bake. You can feel your blood sugar shoot up as you eat them........over and over until they are GONE! 
Make a double batch if you want one for yourself....

Definitely experiment with these bars. I don't care for butterscotch chips (too sweet) so I also used peanut butter chips. I also did half slivered almonds and half pecans. For interest and some tang I also added dried cherries - I will do that going forward - they were great! Oh and use salted butter - it gives it a better contrast between all the sweet toppings.
Easy and YUMMY!!!!!!
had many requests for the recipe. I didn't have graham crumbs so substituted with chocolate ones. Either one would work just as well I am sure.
These were sooo easy and DELICIOUS! Iâ€™m not a big fan of coconut so I didnâ€™t add it and worked out perfectly. I love the butterscotch chips so I added a little extra of those
Switch the butterscotch chips for toffee chips and increase chips and coconut to small bags. Total over indulgence.
Delicious! Make sure to cook for ~25 minutes. We took ours out around 20 minutes and it was a little too gooey. Still tasted great though!
I donâ€™t like butterscotch. Instead, I used peanut butter chocolate chips.
There is no way that 1 1/2 inch piece would ever be considered a serving by anyone I know. Trying to minimize the calories by pinching the size doesnt work for me.

Super easy to make and taste delicious! I will definitely make these again!
My notes: I made it without the walnuts for my friends who are "nut sensitive." The edges stuck like crazy to the pan so I will try using parchment paper next time...or I will slide a spatula along the edge when they're still warm.
I will make these again
Excellent and easy. Used pizza cutter to cut after cooling a few minutes. Then placed in freezer for 15 minutes and they turned out of pan easily.
These are so good!
so good! used half milk chocolate half white chocolate... this is definitely an indulgence
Super easy to make - I followed others reviews to mix the butter and crumbs first. Very sweet
